alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Cottle; Floyd; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 23 at 8:29PM CDT until May 23 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Floyd County in northwestern Texas... Northern Motley County in northwestern Texas... Northwestern Cottle County in northwestern Texas... Hall County in the Panhandle of Texas... Southeastern Briscoe County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 829 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of Caprock Canyon State Park, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Memphis, Silverton, Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Quitaque, Valley Schools, Northfield, Brice, Estelline, Lakeview and Plaska Community. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
